page.title: 15MARY DENDY HOSPITAL
page.content: There are 350 staff. 230 are nurses and the rest are cooks, gardeners etc. Most of the staff do not live on the site. At one time the wards held 50-60 patients. Now they are small dormitories of up to 15. Each patient has a small private area with bed, wardrobe and desk, and curtains round. They can play their own radios and be alone. There are special bathrooms with baths which can be tilted to make it easy to get in to from a wheel chair. Each bath costs Â£2000.There is also a day room for each unit with chairs, tables and a television, that patients are free to use as they wish. There are lots of activities at the home. There are workshops where some of the patients earn money making paper party novelties,plastic garden gnomes and wooden key-rings.
